subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I have not stopped giving thanks for you, remembering you in my prayers. I keep asking that the God of our Lord Jesus Christ, the glorious Father, may give you the Spirit of wisdom and revelation, so that you may know Him better. (Ephesians 1:16, 17) NIV
reflection: Paul's prayer was that the Ephesians would come to know Christ better. This should be the prayer of every Christian, because Christ is to be our model, and the more we know Him, the more we will be like Him. If we study Jesus' life in the Gospels we will see what He was like 2000 years ago, this will cause us to know Him better. A personal knowledge of Christ will change your life.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father I pray for the wisdom to come into a closer relationship with Your Son Jesus Christ, so that I might become more like Him. Amen.
original_content:
10/20/08~~~(food for thought)~~~"He that loveth his brother abideth in the light" 
(I Jn.2:10).

Our Verses for Today:

I have not stopped giving thanks for you, remembering you in my
prayers...

I keep asking that the God of our Lord Jesus Christ, the glorious 
Father, may give you the Spirit of wisdom and revelation, so that
you may know Him better...(Eph. 1:16, 17) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Paul's prayer was that the Ephesians would come to know Christ
better. This should be the prayer of every Christian, because Christ
is to be our model, and the more we know Him, the more we will
be like Him...

If we study Jesus' life in the Gospels we will see what He was like
2000 years ago, this will cause us to know Him better...

A personal knowledge of Christ will change your life...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father I pray for the wisdom to come
into a closer relationship with Your Son Jesus Christ, 
so that I might become more like Him...Amen.

Keep looking up, He is only a prayer away
You are in the prayers of two who care
Pastor Al and Marcie Sather


Ps. Marcie and I had a wonderful time but it is wonderful
to be home too. We traveled through 19 states and through 
two Canadian Provinces...We met some unique people and 
some wonderful Christians...Marcie kept a journal of the people 
we ate with each day on the train. I believe we have over six hundred
pictures on DVD...

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: And His incomparably great power is like the working of His mighty strength, which He exerted in Christ when He raised Him from the dead and seated Him at His right hand in the heavenly realms, (Ephesians 1:19, 20) NIV
reflection: The world fears the power of the atom, yet we belong to the God of the universe, who not only created that atomic power but also raised Jesus Christ from the dead. God's incomparably great power is available to help us. There is nothing to difficult for Him.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your grace and mercy which is new every morning. I pray that You would give me greater faith each day, help me to become more Christ-like each and every day. Amen.
original_content:
10/21/08~~~(food for thought)~~~God never abandons us...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

And His incomparably great power is like the working of His 
mighty strength,

which He exerted in Christ when He raised Him from the dead
and seated Him at His right hand in the heavenly realms, (Eph. 1:19, 20) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

The world fears the power of the atom, yet we belong to
the God of the universe, who not only created that atomic
power but also raised Jesus Christ from the dead...

God's incomparably great power is available to help us.
There is nothing to difficult for Him...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your grace and 
mercy which is new every morning. I pray that You would 
give me greater faith each day, help me to become more
Christ-like each and every day...Amen.

Keep looking up, He knows our every weakness...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Far above all rule and authority, power and dominion and every title that can be given, not only in the present age but also in the one, God placed all thing under His feet and appointed Him to be head over everything for the church. (Ephesians 1:21-22)
reflection: Having been raised from the dead, Christ is now the head of the church, the ultimate authority over the world. Jesus is the messiah, God's anointed one, the one Israel longed for, the one who would set their broken world right. As Christian we can be confident that God has won the final victory and is in control of everything.
prayer: I thank You Lord for the assurance that I have a sure foundation when I place my faith in You. Block from my mind all that would cause me to. Amen.
original_content:
10/22/08~~~(food for thought)~~~"We are made alive in Christ Jesus."

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Far above all rule and authority, power and dominion and
every title that can be given, not only in the present age
but also in the one,

God placed all thing under His feet and appointed Him to
be head over everything for the church...(Eph, 1:21, 22) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Having been raised from the dead, Christ is now the head of
the church, the ultimate authority over the world. Jesus is the 
messiah, God's anointed one, the one Israel longed for, the
one who would set their broken world right...

As Christian we can be confident that God has won the final
victory and is in control of everything...

Our Prayer for Today:
I thank You Lord for the assurance that I have a sure foundation 
when I place my faith in You. Block from my mind all that would
cause me to...Amen.

Keep looking up, and receive His many blessings...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: God placed all things under His feet and appointed Him to be head over everything for the Church, which is His body, the fullness of Him who fills everything in every way. (Ephesians 1:22, 23) NIV
reflection: Christ fills the faithful church with gifts and blessings. The church should be the full expression of Christ, who Himself fills everything (see Ephesians 3:19). When reading Ephesians it is important to remember that it was written primarily to the entire church, not merely to an individual. Christ is the head, and we are the body of His church. Paul uses this metaphor in Romans 12:4, 5; I Corinthians 12:12-27 and Colossians 3:15. The image of the body shows the church's unity. Each member is involved with all the others as they go about doing Christ's word on earth. We should not attempt to work, serve, or worship merely on our own. We need the entire body.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray for continued unity in the church. Help each member be of one mind in all things. open our hearts to receive Godly wisdom from above. Bless each and everyone who reads this devotional with good health and safety. Amen.
original_content:
10/22/08~~~(food for thought)~~~Every Christian is called to be God's people...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

God placed all things under His feet and appointed Him 
to be head over everything for the Church,

which is His body, the fullness of Him who fills everything
in every way...(Eph. 1:22, 23) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Christ fills the faithful church with gifts and blessings. The
church should be the full expression of Christ, who Himself
fills everything (see Eph. 3:19)...

When reading Ephesians it is important to remember that it
was written primarily to the entire church, not merely to an
individual. Christ is the head, and we are the body of His church.

Paul uses this metaphor in Ro. 12:4, 5; I Cor.12:12-27 and
Col. 3:15. The image of the body shows the church's unity.
Each member is involved with all the others as they go about
doing Christ's word on earth...

We should not attempt to work, serve, or worship merely on
our own. We need the entire body...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I pray for continued unity in the church.
Help each member be of one mind in all things. open our hearts
to receive Godly wisdom from above. Bless each and everyone
who reads this devotional with good health and safety...Amen.

Keep looking up, His eye is on the sparrow
and is surely on you...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: As for you, you were dead in your transgressions and sins, In which you used to live when you followed the ways of this world and of the ruler of the kingdom of the air, the spirit who is now at work in those who are disobedient. (Ephesians 2:1, 2) NIV
reflection: The 'ruler of the kingdom of the air' is Satan. Paul's readers believe that Satan and the evil spiritual forces inhabited the region between earth and the sky. And so Satan is pictured as ruling an evil spiritual kingdom ~ with the demons and those who are against Christ. Satan means "the accuser" He is also called the Devil (4:27). In the resurrection, Christ was victorious over Satan and his power. So now Christ is the permanent ruler of the whole world; Satan is only the temporary ruler of the part of the world that chooses to follow him.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that Satan's kingdom would continue to grow smaller and smaller, while the citizens of Your kingdom would grow larger and larger. I pray that there would be a revival in the world ~ a true awakening. I pray that this would be the prayer of every Christian. Amen.
original_content:
10/24/08~~~(food for thought)~~~It is up to every Christian to show the world who God is...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

As for you, you were dead in your transgressions and sins,

In which you used to live when you followed the ways of this 
world and of the ruler of the kingdom of the air, the spirit who
is now at work in those who are disobedient...(Eph. 2:1,2) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

The 'ruler of the kingdom of the air' is Satan.
Paul's readers believe that Satan and the evil spiritual forces
inhabited the region between earth and the sky...

And so Satan is pictured as ruling an evil spiritual kingdom ~
with the demons and those who are against Christ. Satan means 
"the accuser" He is also called the Devil (4:27)...

In the resurrection, Christ was victorious over Satan and his power.
So now Christ is the permanent ruler of the whole world; Satan is
only the temporary ruler of the part of the world that chooses to
follow him...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that Satan's kingdom would
continue to grow smaller and smaller, while the citizens of 
Your kingdom would grow larger and larger. I pray that there
would be a revival in the world ~ a true awakening. I pray that
this would be the prayer of every Christian...Amen.

Keep looking up, He has promised He will return...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Because of His great love for us, God who is rich in mercy, made us alive with Christ even when we were dead in transgressions ~ it is by grace you have been saved. (Ephesians 2:4, 5) NIV
reflection: In verses 1-3 Paul wrote about our old sinful nature. Here Paul emphasizes that we do not need to live any longer under sin's power. The penalty of sin and its power over us were miraculously destroyed by Christ on the cross. Through faith in Christ we stand acquitted, or not guilty, before God (Romans 3:21, 22). God does not take us out of the world or make us robots ~ we will still feel like sinning, and sometimes we will sin. The difference is that before we became Christians, we were dead in sin and were slaves to our sinful nature. BUT now we are alive with Christ (see Galatians 2:20).
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your love and mercy. I thank You for providing a way onto salvation through Your Son, or Lord Jesus Christ. I pray for a sensitive heart that I may be lead by Your Holy Spirit. Amen.
original_content:
10/27/08~~~(food for thought)~~~We serve a God of love...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Because of His great love for us, God who is rich in mercy,

made us alive with Christ even when we were dead in transgressions ~
it is by grace you have been saved...(Eph. 2:4, 5) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

In verses 1-3 Paul wrote about our old sinful nature. Here Paul emphasizes
that we do not need to live any longer under sin's power. The penalty of sin 
and its power over us were miraculously destroyed by Christ on the cross...

Through faith in Christ we stand acquitted, or not guilty, before God (Ro. 3:21, 22).
God does not take us out of the world or make us robots ~ we will still feel like 
sinning, and sometimes we will sin. The difference is that before we became
Christians, we were dead in sin and were slaves to our sinful nature...

BUT now we are alive with Christ (see Gal. 2:20)...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your love and mercy.
I thank You for providing a way onto salvation through Your
Son, or Lord Jesus Christ. I pray for a sensitive heart that I
may be lead by Your Holy Spirit...Amen.

Keep looking up, He wants to guide us in 
the way of eternal life...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: God raised us up with Christ and seated us with Him in the heavenly realms in Christ Jesus. (Ephesians 2:6) NIV
reflection: Because of Christ's resurrection, we know that our body will also be raised from the dead (I Corinthians 15:2-23) and that we will be given the power to live as Christians now (Ephesians 1:19). These ideas are combined in Paul's image of sitting with Christ in the "heavenly realm". Our eternal life with Christ is certain because we are united in His powerful victory. This all came into being because of His great love for us.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the assurance we have of a resurrected life with you, I also thank you for the assurance that Your Holy Spirit is beside me to guide and direct my foot steps into a closer walk with You. Bless all my e-mail friends with good health and safety this week. Amen.
original_content:
10/28/08~~~(food for thought)~~~He continually watches over you...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

God raised us up with Christ and seated us with Him in the
heavenly realms in Christ Jesus...(Eph. 2:6) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Because of Christ's resurrection, we know that our body will also
be raised from the dead (I Cor. 15:2-23) and that we will be given 
the power to live as Christians now (Eph. 1:19)...

These ideas are combined in Paul's image of sitting with Christ in 
the "heavenly realm". Our eternal life with Christ is certain because 
we are united in His powerful victory...

This all came into being because of His great love for us...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the assurance we have
of a resurrected life with you, I also thank you for the assurance
that Your Holy Spirit is beside me to guide and direct my foot
steps into a closer walk with You. Bless all my e-mail friends with 
good health and safety this week...Amen.

Keep looking up, place your hand in the hand
of the man who stilled the waters...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: For it is by grace you have been saved, through faith ~ and this not from yourselves, it is the gift of God ~ not by works, so that no one can boast. (Ephesians 2:8, 9) NIV
reflection: When someone gives you a gift, do you say, "That's very nice~ now how much do I owe you?" NO, the appropriate response to a gift is "Thank you!" Yet how often do Christians, even after they have been given the gift of salvation, feel obligated to try to work their way to God. Because our Salvation and even our faith are gifts, we should respond with gratitude, praise, and joy.
prayer: I thank You dear Lord for the gift of eternal life, even the gift of faith. Forgive me for all the times I have felt I had to work a bit harder to be worthy. Help me Lord to be a better witness to those who do not know about the free gift of eternal life. Amen.
original_content:
10/29/08~~~(food for thought)~~~God gives strength to those who rely on Him...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

For it is by grace you have been saved, through faith ~ 
and this not from yourselves, it is the gift of God ~

not by works, so that no one can boast...(Eph. 2:8, 9) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

When someone gives you a gift, do you say, "That's very nice~ 
now how much do I owe you?"

NO, the appropriate response to a gift is "Thank you!" Yet
how often do Christians, even after they have been given the
gift of salvation, feel obligated to try to work their way to God...

Because our Salvation and even our faith are gifts, we should 
respond with gratitude, praise, and joy...

Our Prayer for Today:
I thank You dear Lord for the gift of eternal life, even
the gift of faith. Forgive me for all the times I have felt
I had to work a bit harder to be worthy. Help me Lord
to be a better witness to those who do not know about
the free gift of eternal life...Amen

Keep looking up, God's grace awaits 
those who come to Him in faith...
You are in the Prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: We are God's workmanship, created in Christ Jesus to do good works, which God prepared in advance for us to. (Ephesians 2:10) NIV
reflection: "We are God's workmanship" another translation says ~ "We are God's masterpiece." It is easy for humans to be proud of what they have accomplished and we have accomplished some extraordinary things ~ BUT ~ let us never forget that our salvation is only something God can do. It is His powerful, creative work in us. Another thought ~ IF ~ God considers us his masterpiece, how dare we treat ourselves ~ OR ~ others for that matter with disrespect or as inferior work.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me for thumbing my noses at others. Help me to remember, every human being is a creation of Yours. Help me to remember that if someone does something I don't agree with, that I pray for them, and examine myselves so that I am not at throne in someone else's side. Amen.
original_content:
10/30/08~~~(food for thought)~~~God sent His Spirit to comfort and encourage...

Our Verse for Today:

We are God's workmanship, created in Christ Jesus 
to do good works, which God prepared in advance 
for us to...(Eph. 2:10) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

"We are God's workmanship" another translation says ~
"We are God's masterpiece."

It is easy for humans to be proud of what they have accomplished
and we have accomplished some extraordinary things ~ BUT ~ let
us never forget that our salvation is only something God can do...
It is His powerful, creative work in us. 

Another thought ~ IF ~ God considers us his masterpiece, how dare 
we treat ourselves ~ OR ~ others for that matter with disrespect or as 
inferior work...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me for thumbing my noses at 
others. Help me to remember, every human being is a creation
of Yours. Help me to remember that if someone does something
I don't agree with, that I pray for them, and examine myselves so 
that I am not at throne in someone else's side...Amen.

Keep looking up, Seek Godly wisdom from above...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor AL & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Therefore, remember that formality you who are Gentiles by birth and called "uncircumcised" by those who call themselves "the circumcision" (that done in the body by the hands of men) ~ remember that at that time you were separate from Christ, excluded from citizenship in Israel and foreigners to the covenants of the promise, without hope and without God in the world. But now in Christ Jesus you who once were far away have been brought near through the blood of Christ. (Ephesians 2:11-13) NIV
reflection: Jews and Gentiles alike could be guilty of spiritual pride ~ Jews for thinking their faith and traditions elevated them above everyone else. Gentiles for trusting in their achievements, power, or position. Spiritual pride blinds us to our own faults and magnifies the faults of others, Be careful not to become proud of your salvation. Instead, humbly thank God for what He has done, and encourage others who might be struggling in their faith.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I do thank You for the wonderful gift of salvation that is mine through faith in the shed blood of Christ. Forgive me for any spiritual pride I have shown in the past, remembering that salvation is a gift, not something I have achieved by any works of my own. Amen.
original_content:
10/31/08~~~(food for thought)~~~Let us stop each day a remember how great a gift we 
have been given through the shed blood of Christ..

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Therefore, remember that formality you who are Gentiles by birth
and called "uncircumcised" by those who call themselves "the
circumcision" (that done in the body by the hands of men) ~

remember that at that time you were separate from Christ, excluded
from citizenship in Israel and foreigners to the covenants of the promise,
without hope and without God in the world...

But now in Christ Jesus you who once were far away have been brought 
near through the blood of Christ...(Eph. 2:11-13) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Jews and Gentiles alike could be guilty of spiritual pride ~ Jews for thinking
their faith and traditions elevated them above everyone else. Gentiles for 
trusting in their achievements, power, or position...

Spiritual pride blinds us to our own faults and magnifies the faults of others,
Be careful not to become proud of your salvation. Instead, humbly thank God
for what He has done, and encourage others who might be struggling in
their faith...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I do thank You for the wonderful gift of 
salvation that is mine through faith in the shed blood of Christ.
Forgive me for any spiritual pride I have shown in the past,
remembering that salvation is a gift, not something I have achieved
by any works of my own...Amen.

Keep looking up, He is a mighty fortress...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
